Officers fired over selfie that reenacted chokehold used on Elijah McClainOne of the white officers who stopped Elijah McClain was fired over photos showing colleagues reenacting the chokehold used on the Black man before he died last year, authorities said Friday. After getting a text message with the images, he replied, “haha."

Fauci praises Mass. response to coronavirus as state’s key indicators continue downward trendMassachusetts health officials on Friday reported that 17 more people have died from the coronavirus, and another 290 people have contracted it, bringing the total death toll in the state to 8,149 and the total case count to 109,628.

EEE detected in Mass. mosquitoes for first time this yearMassachusetts health officials are reminding residents to wear bug spray after eastern equine encephalitis, or EEE, was detected in a sample of mosquitoes for the first time this year.
Cleveland Indians look into changing name amid pressure The club has been known as the Indians since 1915, but have long since begun distancing themselves from the name and its imagery.
Maine explains travel restrictions against Mass. residentsEarlier Thursday, Gov. Charlie Baker had vowed to call Maine Gov. Janet Mills to ask about the additional restrictions.

Protesters return to St. Louis area where couple drew gunsSeveral hundred protesters made a peaceful return trip Friday to the St. Louis mansion owned by a white couple whose armed defense of their home during an earlier demonstration earned them both scorn and support.

A problem for colleges in the fall: reluctant professorsThousands of instructors at American colleges and universities have told administrators in recent days that they are unwilling to resume in-person classes because of the pandemic.

Baker says Phase 3 of reopening will begin on Monday, except in BostonIn announcing the start of Phase 3, which includes the reopening of gyms, fitness centers, and museums, Governor Charlie Baker also said professional sports teams would be able to hold games without spectators and announced updated guidelines on indoor and outdoor gatherings.
